intro: Dichrotrichum papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan dichrotrichum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open areas with ample sunlight. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
